intro: Tetrastigma yunnanense var. glabrum, commonly known as the Yunnan grapevine, is a climbing vine native to China. It belongs to the Vitaceae family and is characterized by its compound leaves and small, clustered flowers. The plant produces small, yellowish-green berries that are typically edible. It thrives in warm, humid climates and is often found in forested areas. Its botanical features make it a subject of interest in both horticulture and botanical research.
